text: Festival of Slightly Bright Ideas: mismatched hats and graffiti-filled patents.
Raid of the Midnight Snack: citizens defend a bakery from phantom hunger.
The Parade of Minor Triumphs celebrates trivial victories with confetti.
The Night of Soft Questions yields quieter inquiries and better answers.
The Eclipse Market appears when enough people agree to be pleasantly surprised.
The Day of Returned Calls encourages answering old messages.
Lanterns of Maybe drift messages to those who need them most.
The Great Meme Exchange happens seasonally and is surprisingly polite.
The Hour of Novelty resets all clocks and permits new hobbies guilt-free.
The Quiet Parade moves slowly so people can finish their thoughts.
The Breakfast of Champions serves toast with mild prophecy.
The Trial of Lost Notifications judges all forgotten pings fairly.
The Moonlight Bazaar sells bottled starlight as souvenirs.
The Week of Small Wins asks citizens to share one tiny victory per day.
The Return of Forgotten Passwords involves chanting and mild panic.
